div1.head: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, April 4, 1900
div1.opener:
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Station and Duty.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
U. S. Army Medical Museum and Library,
Corner 7th and B Streets SW.,
Washington, April 4, 1900.
TO THE ADJUTANT GENERAL,
U. S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to report that from March 1 to March 7, 1900,
I have been on duty in the Surgeon General's Office as Curator of the
Army Medical Museum, in accordance with Par. 2, S.O. No. 153, dated
Headquarters of the Army, Adjutant General's Office, Washington, D.C.
July 7, 1893. From March 7 to March 10 en route to Havana, Cuba,
and from March 10 to March 31, on duty at Havana, under Special Orders
No. 51, Par. 16, Headquarters of the Army, Adjutant General's Office,
Washington, March 2, 1900.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Walter Reed, Major & Surgeon,
U. S. Army.
